intro: Miconia andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it has been cultivated in botanical gardens and is sometimes considered an invasive species in non-native habitats.
